meta.name: Archer Newbie Quest: Zero to Hero Learning Activity
meta.description: A complete beginner's guide to Archer on-prem. By completing this quest, you'll master all the skills needed to pass the Archer Associate Exam.
meta.target_audience: Complete beginners with zero Archer knowledge
meta.prerequisites: Access to an on-prem Archer instance

introduction.welcome: Welcome, brave adventurer! You're about to embark on a quest to master Archer - a powerful platform for risk management and compliance. Don't worry if you've never used Archer before - this quest assumes you know absolutely nothing and will guide you step-by-step.
introduction.what_is_archer: Think of Archer as a super-organized digital filing system where organizations track risks, compliance, audits, and other important business stuff. Instead of messy spreadsheets and emails, everything lives in one place with proper tracking and workflows.
introduction.your_quest: You'll create a 'Personal Skills Development Tracker' to track your own learning journey. Along the way, you'll learn every fundamental Archer skill needed to pass the Associate Exam.
introduction.how_it_works: This quest has levels. Each level teaches you a new skill with clear instructions. Complete them in order - each builds on the previous one!

levels.title: First Steps: Logging In & Finding Your Way

tasks.name: Log In to Archer
instructions: Open your web browser and go to your organization's Archer URL (ask your IT team if you don't know it)
Enter your username and password (these should be provided by your Archer administrator)
Click 'Login' or press Enter
SUCCESS: You're in! You should see a dashboard with various boxes and information
tasks.what_you_see: You're looking at your default dashboard. This is your 'home base' in Archer.
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: When users log in to Archer, their home view is of a Dashboard. Remember this!

tasks.name: Explore the Top Menu Bar
instructions: Look at the very top of the screen - this is your menu bar
On the LEFT: You'll see your organization's logo/image
In the MIDDLE: There's a search box (this is Global Search)
On the RIGHT: Look for icons - Activity (clock), Help (?), and your User Menu (your name/avatar)
practice: Click on the Activity icon (clock) - see your 10 most recently viewed records
Click on the Help icon (?) - explore help resources
Click on your User Menu (top right) - see options like Preferences
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: The Activity icon shows your 10 most recently added, edited, or viewed records. The menu bar does NOT have map display controls!

tasks.name: Return to Your Homepage
instructions: Click around Archer a bit - open some links, explore
Now, click on the IMAGE/LOGO in the TOP LEFT CORNER
BOOM! You're back to your default homepage/workspace
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Clicking the image in the top left corner returns you to your default homepage. This is a common exam question!

levels.level_complete: Level 1 Complete! You can now navigate Archer's interface like a pro. Time to dig deeper!

levels.title: Understanding the Archer Universe
skills_learned: Understand Solutions, Use Cases, and Applications
levels.story: Imagine Archer as a library. Solutions are like different floors (Risk Management, Compliance, etc.). Use Cases are like sections on each floor (Risk Assessment, Audit Management). Applications are like specific bookshelves. Records are the individual books.

tasks.name: Find the Left Panel Menu
instructions: Look on the LEFT SIDE of your screen
You should see a panel with icons or text labels
This shows your available WORKSPACES
Click on one to explore it
tasks.what_you_see: Workspaces organize dashboards. Different teams might have different workspaces (Risk Team, Audit Team, etc.).
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: A Workspace is an organized display of Dashboards.

tasks.name: Navigate to an Application
instructions: From your workspace, look for 'Solutions' or a list of available areas
Click on a Solution (like 'IT & Security' or 'Operational Risk')
You'll see Use Cases - these are pre-configured application groups
Click on a Use Case
You'll see Applications - click on one to open it
You'll see a list of RECORDS (individual data entries)
tasks.navigation_path: Workspace ‚Üí Solution ‚Üí Use Case ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Records
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: The correct path to access all records in an application is Workspace > Solution > Application. Use Cases are ready-to-use application groups that come pre-configured with Archer.

tasks.name: Understand What You're Looking At
instructions: SOLUTION: A grouping of applications for a specific business need (like 'Risk Management')
USE CASE: Pre-configured applications ready to use immediately (like 'Issues Management')
APPLICATION: Houses specific sets of RECORDS (like 'Business Continuity Plans')
RECORDS: Individual data entries (like 'Plan #12345')
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Applications house specific sets of Records. Use Cases are groups of pre-configured Applications. Remember this hierarchy!

levels.level_complete: Level 2 Complete! You understand Archer's structure. Now let's create something!

levels.title: Creating Your First Record

tasks.name: Find an Application You Can Edit
instructions: Navigate to an Application (use the path from Level 2)
Look for a button that says 'New Record' (Classic UI) or 'Add New Record' (SaaS UI)
If you DON'T see this button, you don't have permission to create records here - try a different application
Once you find an application with the New Record button, click it!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To add new data when it doesn't exist, click the New Record icon (Classic UI) or Add New Record (SaaS UI).

tasks.name: Understand the Fields
instructions: You're now looking at a blank record form
Look for FIELDS - these are the boxes where you enter information
RED ASTERISKS (*) = REQUIRED FIELDS - you MUST fill these out
Some fields might be GRAYED OUT - these could be:
- CALCULATED FIELDS: They auto-fill based on other fields
- READ-ONLY FIELDS: Marked by a Data-Driven Event
- SYSTEM FIELDS: Managed automatically by Archer
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Record fields with red asterisks are Required Fields. Calculated fields cannot be edited manually and change based on other field values.

tasks.name: Fill Out Your First Record
instructions: Fill in the REQUIRED FIELDS (ones with red asterisks)
If you see any CALCULATED FIELDS (grayed out, required), don't worry - they'll populate when you save
Add information to a few optional fields too
Now comes the MOST IMPORTANT PART...
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Required calculated fields will populate once the record is saved. This is why some required fields can't be manually edited.

tasks.name: SAVE YOUR RECORD (DON'T MESS THIS UP!)
instructions: Look for a SAVE button (usually at the top or bottom of the record)
Click SAVE
Wait for confirmation that your record was saved
‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL WARNING: If you DON'T click Save, your changes will be LOST when you close the record!
common_mistakes: Ruth's Story: Ruth updated a record and closed it without clicking Save. When she opened it again, her changes were gone. Don't be like Ruth!
The Rule: ALWAYS click Save before closing a record
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: The 'Save' option saves edits to a record. If you don't select Save, your changes won't be kept. This is a common exam scenario!

levels.level_complete: Level 3 Complete! You've created and saved your first record. Ruth would be proud!

levels.title: Editing & Managing Records

tasks.name: Find and Open Your Record
instructions: Navigate back to the application where you created your record
Find your record in the list (it should show recent records first)
Click on the RECORD ID (the linked number) to open it
The link takes you directly to the record itself
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Clicking on a linked record ID takes you to the record itself.

tasks.name: Try to Edit Your Record
instructions: Look for an EDIT button
If the Edit button is AVAILABLE: Click it and make some changes
If the Edit button is GRAYED OUT: This means:
- You don't have editing permissions for this record, OR
- Someone else is working on it at the same time, OR
- The application is set to Retired
tasks.scenario: Sonja's Story: Sonja wanted to add a note but the Edit button was grayed out. Why? She didn't have editing permissions for that record.
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: If the Edit button is grayed out, the most common reason is that you don't have editing permissions.

tasks.name: View the History Log
instructions: While viewing your record, look for 'History Log' or 'Change Log'
In Classic UI: Can be displayed as a grid or simple link
In SaaS UI: Appears in the right panel with cool features:
- Click on changes to highlight modified fields
- Filter changes by date, user(s), and/or fields
This shows who changed what and when
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: In SaaS UI, the History Log has all these behaviors - clickable changes, filtering options, and appears in the right panel.

tasks.name: Add a Comment (if available)
instructions: Some records (like questionnaires) let you add comments
Look for a 'Comments' section or comment icon
If you see it, open and submit a comment
This is useful for providing additional information
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To provide additional information to a questionnaire item, open and submit a comment attached to the question.

levels.level_complete: Level 4 Complete! You can now manage records like a pro. Time to learn about finding data!

levels.title: Searching & Finding Data

tasks.name: Try a Global Search
instructions: Look at the SEARCH BOX in the top menu bar
Type a word or phrase (try searching for something you know exists)
Press Enter or click the search icon
Global Search looks across ALL data in Archer that you have access to
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Archer's Global Search allows users to search across all data within Archer that the user has access to. It doesn't search the internet or intranet!

tasks.name: Transfer Search to Specific Application
instructions: After performing a global search, you'll see results
Look for an option to 'Transfer to Application' or similar
This lets you narrow your search to a specific application
Try it!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: After a global search, users can transfer the search to a specific application.

tasks.name: Perform a Keyword Search
instructions: Navigate to an Application
Look for a search option within the application
Enter a keyword or phrase
Keyword searches look for specific words within one or more APPLICATIONS (not workspaces or reports)
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: A keyword search searches for a specific word or string within one or more Applications.

tasks.name: Try Advanced Search with Filters
instructions: In an Application, look for 'Advanced Search' or a filter icon
Click it to see filter options
You can filter by:
‚úì Date ranges
‚úì Cross-referenced field selections
‚úì Value List Fields
‚úó NOT by Size of Records (this is NOT a filter option!)
Try adding a filter and running the search
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Users CANNOT filter search results by 'Size of Records'. All other options (date ranges, cross-referenced fields, value lists) are valid.

levels.level_complete: Level 5 Complete! You're now a search ninja. Time to create reports!

levels.title: Creating Reports

tasks.name: Save Your Search as a Report
instructions: After performing an advanced search, look for 'Save' or 'Save As Report'
Click it
You'll be asked to:
- Name your report
- Add a description (for later reference)
- Choose report type: Personal, Shared, or Global
REMEMBER: You're saving the SEARCH SETTINGS, not the exact data

report_types.global: Can be set to be seen by others, as you designate

tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Personal reports are only visible to the person who created them. Global reports can be set to be seen by others. Saving a report saves the search settings, not the exact data.

tasks.name: Modify an Existing Report
instructions: Find one of your saved reports
Look for 'Modify' (Classic UI) or 'Edit Search' (SaaS UI)
Click it to change the filters and criteria
This is how Terri would edit her report to make data more relevant!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To edit filters in an existing report, select 'Modify' (Classic UI) or 'Edit Search' (SaaS UI).

tasks.name: Try Report Visualization Options
instructions: When creating/editing a report, look for 'Visualization Display Options'
Try different views:
- FLAT: Standard list view
- HIERARCHICAL: Groups results by a specific field (useful for organizing data)
- SUMMARY: Shows totals and counts
If you want to group results by a field, choose HIERARCHICAL
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: In Visualization Display Options, select 'Hierarchical' to group results by a specific field.

tasks.name: Export Your Report
instructions: Open one of your reports
Look for an 'Export' option
You can export in multiple formats:
- CSV (comma-separated values)
- Excel (spreadsheet)
- PDF (document)
Try exporting to PDF and check the file!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Reports can be exported in CSV, Excel, OR PDF formats - any of these!

tasks.name: Understanding Report Access
instructions: Create a report that shows records 'Assigned To' the current user
This is how 'My Tasks' reports work
The report uses a filter on the 'Assigned To' field
This limits results to only records the logged-in user can access
This is why Serena saw 5 tasks and Beth saw 10 - the filter showed each person only their assigned tasks!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Reports can use filters on the 'Assigned To' field to limit results to records for the currently logged-in user. This is the most likely reason two users see different results on the same report.

levels.level_complete: Level 6 Complete! You're now a reporting master. Let's set up automation!

levels.title: Dashboards & Visualization

tasks.name: Explore Your Dashboard
instructions: Return to your homepage (click the logo!)
You're looking at a dashboard
Dashboards can contain:
- iViews (custom views of data)
- Widgets (interactive components)
- Charts (visual representations)
These can display links, embedded content, charts - any of these!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: An iView or Widget can display Links, Embedded external content, OR Charts - any of these options!

tasks.name: Interact with a Chart
instructions: Find a chart on your dashboard (a pie chart, bar graph, etc.)
Click on an area of the chart (like a slice or bar)
MAGIC: It opens a list of records associated with that statistic!
This lets you drill down from summary data to detailed records
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Clicking on a chart area opens a list of records associated with that chart statistic.

tasks.name: Understand Dashboard Permissions
instructions: Personal Dashboards: You create and edit for yourself
Global Dashboards: With admin rights, you can create and share with others
With appropriate admin rights, you can:
‚úì Edit and share global dashboards
‚úì Create and edit personal dashboards
‚úì Create global reports
‚úì All of these!
Note: Different users might see different dashboard content based on their access rights
This is why Srishti and Jamie saw different reports - they had different access rights!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: With appropriate administrative rights, end users can do all of these: edit/share global dashboards, create/edit personal dashboards, and create global reports. Dashboard differences between users are usually due to different access rights.

tasks.name: Set Up Quick Links
instructions: Look for a 'Quick Links' section in your workspace
Quick Links let you jump directly to commonly-used actions
For example: If you frequently create new findings, add a Quick Link to 'New Finding Record'
This saves you from navigating Workspace > Solution > Application every time
This is perfect for Nate who needs to quickly log findings without navigating every time!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Quick Links allow users to quickly create new records without having to navigate to the application every time.

levels.level_complete: Level 7 Complete! Your dashboard game is strong. Let's automate communications!

levels.title: Notifications & Subscriptions

tasks.name: Manage Email Subscriptions
instructions: Click on your User Menu (top right)
Go to Preferences > Email Subscription
You'll see a list of reports/notifications you're subscribed to
Each has a checkbox - check to subscribe, uncheck to unsubscribe
This is how Ayanna would opt out of that weekly risk report!
And how Anca would check if she's subscribed to the quarterly report!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To opt out of an email report subscription, navigate to User Menu > Preferences > Email Subscription, locate the report, and uncheck the subscribed box.

tasks.name: Create a Scheduled Notification
instructions: This requires admin rights, but good to understand
Scheduled notifications remind users when something is due
Example: Remind team when reports are due within 7 days
Based on a date field (like 'Due Date')
This is what Beatrice should create for her quarterly risk reports!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To remind a team when reports are due within a set timeframe, create a scheduled notification based on the due date field.

tasks.name: Set Up Scheduled Report Distribution
instructions: Open one of your saved reports
Look for 'Schedule' or 'Distribution' options
You can set the report to run automatically:
- Daily, Weekly, Monthly, etc.
- At specific times
- Sent to specific people
Once scheduled, Archer runs the report AUTOMATICALLY
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: When a user creates a Scheduled Report Distribution, Archer will run the report Automatically (not manually).

tasks.name: Email a Record Link
instructions: Open any record you have access to
Look for 'Share' or 'Email Record' option
Select 'Email Record' (Share > Email)
This opens a new email in YOUR email client
The email includes a LINK to the record
The recipient can click the link to view the record (if they have access)
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Email Record (Share > Email) opens a new email in the user's email client with a link to the record. It does NOT send a downloadable copy or sign them up for notifications.

levels.level_complete: Level 8 Complete! You've automated communication like a boss. Let's dive into data management!

levels.title: Data Management & Integration

tasks.name: Understand Data Import Methods
instructions: Archer can import data in several ways:
‚úì DATA FEEDS: Import from external systems (via Data Feed Manager)
‚úì MANUAL DATA IMPORT: Upload files manually
‚úì API: Programmatic integration
‚úó SCANNING: This is NOT a valid import method!
Each serves different purposes
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Scanning is NOT a method to import data into Archer. Valid methods are Data Feeds, Manual Import, and API. Data feeds are managed through the Data Feed Manager feature.

tasks.name: Understand Data Feeds
instructions: Data Feeds = Importing data INTO Archer from external systems
Ideal for: Regular, scheduled imports
Example: Daily import of vulnerability scan results
JavaScript Transporters are a type of Data Feed
Set to run on a pre-defined schedule
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: JavaScript Transporters are a type of Data Feed. Data Feeds are ideal for Archer data to be added or modified on a pre-defined schedule.

tasks.name: Understand Data Publications
instructions: Data Publications = EXPORTING data OUT OF Archer
Extract data from Archer and load it to an external database
Opposite of Data Feeds!
Used for: Sending Archer data to external systems on a regular cadence
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Data Publications allow users to extract data from Archer and load it to an external database. Data Feeds are for data to be sent OUT of Archer into an external database on a regular cadence.

tasks.name: Work with Cross-Referenced Fields
instructions: Navigate to an application
Try creating a report with 'Add New Relationship'
This lets you include fields from cross-referenced applications
Cross-references link records between different applications
Example: Link a Risk record to a Control record
This is what Doug should use to include cross-referenced application fields!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To create a report with fields from a cross-referenced application, choose 'Add New Relationship' on the search page.

tasks.name: Why Archer Beats Spreadsheets
instructions: Remember Andre's problem with spreadsheets?
Spreadsheets have issues:
- Potential data loss from corrupted files
- Human error in manual updates
- No proactive risk trend analysis
- ALL OF THESE!
Archer solves these by:
- Centralized, secure data storage
- Automated workflows and notifications
- Real-time trend analysis and reporting
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Manual spreadsheet management puts organizations at risk due to ALL of these: potential data loss, human error, and inability to analyze trends proactively.

levels.level_complete: Level 9 Complete! You understand data management and integration. Let's explore advanced features!

levels.title: Advanced Features & Workflows

tasks.name: Understand Advanced Workflow
instructions: Some records use Advanced Workflow
These records have an ACTIONS DROPDOWN MENU near the top
Use this dropdown to advance the record to the next workflow stage
Example: Move a finding from 'Draft' to 'Under Review' to 'Closed'
Non-workflow records don't have this feature
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Records with Advanced Workflow have an Actions dropdown menu at the top. Users use this to advance records to the next stage of the workflow.

tasks.name: Use the Attention Feature (SaaS UI)
instructions: In the new SaaS UI, look at the RIGHT PANEL
The 'Attention' feature highlights EMPTY FIELDS
It draws your attention to fields that need to be filled out
Helps ensure you don't miss required information
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: In the SaaS UI, the Attention feature in the right panel draws the user's attention to fields that are empty.

tasks.name: Try In-Line Editing (Classic UI)
instructions: View a search results page in Classic UI
Look for a small PENCIL ICON next to a field name
This means you can edit that field directly from the search results!
No need to open the full record
Super efficient for quick updates
This is what Steven noticed with the pencil icon!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: A pencil icon next to a field in search results means you can edit the field for various records right from within the search results themselves.

levels.level_complete: Level 10 Complete! You're mastering advanced features. Let's cover security and permissions!

levels.title: Security & Permissions

tasks.name: Understand User Accounts
instructions: Access to Archer is controlled by USER ACCOUNTS
Each user has a username and password
This is your authentication
Administrators create and manage user accounts
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Access to the Archer platform is controlled by User Accounts (username and password).

tasks.name: Learn About Groups
instructions: Users are assigned to GROUPS
Groups determine what you can access
Every user automatically belongs to the 'EVERYONE' group
When you change roles (like Laszlo), ask your admin to:
- Assign you to new groups
- Update your access roles
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: All system users automatically belong to a built-in group named 'Everyone'. When changing roles, ask your Archer administrator to assign you to appropriate groups and access roles.

tasks.name: Understand Access Rights
instructions: Archer has specific rights that can be assigned:
‚úì CREATE: Make new records
‚úì READ: View records
‚úì UPDATE: Edit records
‚úì DELETE: Remove records
‚úó APPEND: This is NOT a valid Archer right!
Your rights determine what you can do in each application
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: APPEND is NOT a right that can be assigned in Archer. Valid rights are CREATE, READ, UPDATE, and DELETE.

tasks.name: Check Licensing Information
instructions: To see what your organization has purchased from Archer:
Look for 'Licensing Information' in the admin area
This shows:
- Which solutions are licensed
- How many user licenses you have
- What features are available
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: To determine what an organization has purchased from Archer, an administrator should check the Licensing Information.

levels.level_complete: Level 11 Complete! You understand security and permissions. Time to learn about Archer Solutions!

levels.title: Archer Solutions & Use Cases

tasks.name: Understand Solution Areas
instructions: Archer organizes content into SOLUTION AREAS
Common Solution Areas include:
- IT & Security
- Operational Risk
- Compliance
- Audit
- Third Party Management
Each Solution Area contains related USE CASES
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Archer Solution Areas contain groups of related Use Cases. Archer's primary purpose is to support risk management and compliance activities.

tasks.name: Learn Common Use Cases
instructions: Key Use Cases to know:
1. ISSUES MANAGEMENT: Document events/findings that need resolution (seen in nearly every Solution Area)
2. REGULATORY & COMPLIANCE: Consolidate regulatory info into searchable repository
3. AUDIT MANAGEMENT: Manage internal/external audit processes and track findings
4. THIRD PARTY MANAGEMENT: Manage supplier relationships and monitor third-party risks
5. BUSINESS CONTINUITY: Plan for business resiliency and disaster recovery
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Issues Management is the Use Case seen in nearly every Solution Area. It helps organizations document events (Findings) that need to be resolved, often for compliance reasons.

tasks.name: Understand Custom vs Pre-Built Apps
instructions: ON-DEMAND APPLICATIONS: Entirely designed and deployed by your organization for specific business needs
USE CASES: Pre-configured applications ready to use immediately after deployment
Your organization can use both!
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Applications entirely designed and deployed by your organization for specific business needs are called On-Demand Applications. Use Cases are pre-configured and ready to use immediately.

tasks.name: Learn About Archer Evolv
instructions: Archer Evolv is the modern product suite:
ARCHER EVOLV RISK:
- End-to-end risk management framework
- AI and machine learning for risk prediction
- Real-time security data integration
- Centralized platform for monitoring and mitigating risks
ARCHER EVOLV COMPLIANCE:
- Continuous monitoring of regulatory changes
- Document processing with AI
- Obligations catalog
- Controls alignment
- Building centralized global library of obligations
tasks.exam_tip: EXAM FACT: Archer Evolv Risk uses AI and machine learning to predict potential risks and optimize workflows. It provides a centralized platform for monitoring and mitigating risks in real time. Archer Evolv Compliance's value includes ALL of: AI-powered regulatory change program, centralized obligations library, and controls alignment.

levels.level_complete: Level 12 Complete! You understand Archer's solutions and products. Final boss level ahead!

levels.title: FINAL BOSS: Master Quest Challenge
levels.scenario: You are a new Risk Analyst at XYZ Corporation. Your manager asks you to complete the following tasks using Archer.

tasks.name: Navigate and Create a Record

2. Navigate to the Issues Management application (Workspace > Solution > Application)
3. Create a new Issue record about a data security concern

5. SAVE the record (don't be like Ruth!)
6. Note the Record ID

tasks.name: Search and Report
challenge: 1. Use Global Search to find all issues related to 'security'
2. Transfer the search to the Issues Management application
3. Add filters: Date range of last 30 days, Status = Open
4. Save the search as a Personal Report called 'My Open Security Issues'
5. Change visualization to Hierarchical, grouped by Priority
6. Export the report to PDF

tasks.name: Dashboards and Quick Access
challenge: 1. Return to your homepage (click the logo!)
2. Find a chart on your dashboard and click on it to drill down
3. Set up a Quick Link to create new Issue records quickly
4. Check your Activity icon to see your recent records

tasks.name: Communication and Automation
challenge: 1. Go to User Menu > Preferences > Email Subscription
2. Subscribe to any available report notifications
3. Open your newly created Issue record
4. Use Share > Email Record to send the link to yourself

tasks.name: Demonstrate Knowledge

5. What Use Case is seen in nearly every Solution Area?
6. How do you return to your homepage quickly?
7. What does a red asterisk on a field mean?
8. What can iViews display? (links, charts, embedded content)
9. What's the difference between Personal and Global reports?
10. What does Archer Evolv Risk use to predict potential risks?
answers: 3. Data Feeds import INTO Archer; Data Publications export OUT OF Archer
6. Click the logo in the top left
8. Any of these / All of these
9. Personal = only you; Global = can be shared with others

conclusion.congratulations: Congratulations, Archer Champion! You've gone from zero to hero.
what_you_learned: ‚úì Navigate Archer's interface like a pro
conclusion.exam_readiness: You've practiced every key concept that appears on the Archer Associate Exam. The questions you'll see will test exactly what you just learned.
next_steps: 1. Review the exam tips from each level
2. Practice in your Archer environment regularly
3. Take practice quizzes using the question bank
conclusion.final_wisdom: Just like creating a D&D character sheet taught the basics of Archer, this quest has taught you everything you need. The exam is just validating what you already know. Go smash it!

top_10_exam_facts: 1. Click SAVE to save record changes - not clicking loses all changes
2. Click the logo (top left) to return to homepage/default workspace
4. Valid access rights: CREATE, READ, UPDATE, DELETE (NOT append)
5. Everyone group = all users automatically belong
6. Issues Management = Use Case seen in nearly every Solution Area
7. Data Feeds = import INTO Archer; Data Publications = export OUT OF Archer
8. Personal reports = only you; Global reports = can be shared
9. Keyword search searches within Applications (not workspaces/reports)
10. Calculated fields auto-populate based on other fields

navigation_paths.create_record: Application > New Record (Classic) or Add New Record (SaaS)

common_mistakes_to_avoid: ‚ùå Forgetting to click Save before closing records
‚ùå Thinking you can filter by 'Size of Records' (you can't!)
‚ùå Confusing Data Feeds (import) with Data Publications (export)
‚ùå Thinking APPEND is a valid access right (it's not!)
‚ùå Trying to edit calculated fields manually (they're auto-calculated)
‚ùå Not checking if you have edit permissions when Edit is grayed out
